key_responsibilities: Managing all aspects of the member’s daily and long-term schedule in Washington and the District, including intaking, evaluating, and scheduling meeting requests, updating and ensuring accuracy of member’s calendar, and coordinating travel arrangements and day-to-day logistics
Working with legislative and press staff to ensure member is prepared for engagements
Managing member personal correspondence and records
Interfacing with government agencies, Congressional offices, and outside organizations on behalf of the Member
Working with staff to coordinate staff-level meetings and manage office meeting space

Attention to detail
Ability to manage competing demands and deadlines
Texas ties preferred
Spanish proficiency highly desired but not required
Valid driver’s license and access to a vehicle preferred

key_responsibilities: Identifying and developing new areas for legislative action
Monitoring developments in relevant legislation on the floor and within committees
Briefing and staffing the member for meetings with stakeholders
Helping staff the member on relevant issues at the Committee on Oversight and Accountability and the Committee on Homeland Security, meeting with stakeholders both with and without the Representative
Collaborating with District staff to advocate for federal projects, local needs, and initiatives
requirements: Relevant experience required
Ties to NY-10 preferred
Second language a plus

key_responsibilities: Drafting daily social media content for all of the Congressman’s official platforms, subject to editing
Creating graphics
Shooting and editing videos
Sending daily news clips
Drafting op-eds on a variety of issues and e-newsletters
Working with district staff to produce regular virtual and tele-town hall meetings

requirements: Strong writing and digital media skills
Close attention to proofreading and fact-checking
Highly organized
Problem-solving approach to work
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment
Ability to meet deadlines
Proficiency with social media tools, graphic design and standard Microsoft Office and Adobe software tools
Working knowledge of House processes and procedures

key_responsibilities: Working closely with the Chief of Staff and District Director on a broad range of scheduling and executive operations including tracking, evaluating, and responding to all invitations and scheduling requests
Coordinating travel
Managing all aspects of the Congresswoman’s daily and long-term schedule
requirements: Previous administrative or scheduling experience preferred
Desire to join a highly-collaborative, action-oriented team

key_responsibilities: Develop and execute strategic communication plans in collaboration with senior staff and the legislative team, ensuring alignment with the Congresswoman's priorities and legislative initiatives
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with local and national print, radio, and broadcast media professionals
Successfully pitch the Congresswoman to both local and national TV, radio, and print media, positioning her effectively on key issues
Plan and manage press conferences, tele-townhalls, roundtables, and other events in both Washington, D.C., and the district
Prepare, brief, and accompany the Congresswoman for media interviews, press conferences, roundtables, and other public engagements
Draft talking points, speeches, press releases, op-eds, and other materials in the Congresswoman's voice
Manage the Congresswoman's social media presence, including drafting engaging content, clipping interviews, and creating graphics for various platforms
Ensure that the office website features timely and relevant content
Stay informed about current news and legislative issues that may impact the Congresswoman's work
requirements: Exceptional Communication Skills
Media Proficiency
Experience: 2-5 years of experience in developing communication strategy for elected officials, government agencies, non-profit organizations, or similar entities
Team Player
Deadline-Oriented
Strategic Thinker
Adaptability
Constructive Feedback
Relationship Building

key_responsibilities: Providing strategic planning
Executing the Member’s legislative agenda and policy plans

Supervising the legislative staff, supporting and coaching the team to deliver tangible resources and legislative victories, including moving pieces of legislation, drafting letters to federal agencies, and driving federal funding back to the district
Overseeing floor vote recommendations and drafting legislative memos for votes each week

Professional writing
Robust leadership, mentorship and management abilities
Capability to build and cultivate a high performing team
Proactive and creative problem-solving
Ability to operate and deliver under tight deadlines in high-pressure situations

Providing legal advice on financial disclosure related matters
Providing education and training to Members of Congress and their staff through frequent telephone calls, in-person meetings, and written work product

key_responsibilities: Advancing current and new legislative initiatives including idea generation, building support, legislative drafting and producing accompanying materials, such as speeches, policy memos, and factsheets

Representing the Congresswoman’s priorities with external stakeholders
Building and maintaining relationships with external and internal stakeholders including advocacy organizations; academics; fellow Congressional and Committee offices
Carrying out additional duties as required

Passionate about public service and committed to progressive values
Excellent writing and time management skills
Ability to digest new content with a political and ideological lens that is appropriate for the office

Poised, level-headed, flexible, collaborative, team oriented
Eager to learn, grow, and thrive in a dynamic and high-paced environment

key_responsibilities: Ensuring outreach efforts align with the Member’s strategic vision and goals
Coordinating closely with staff to ensure district priorities are reflective in legislative priorities
Building and maintaining relationships with constituents and key community leaders
Organizing and participating in community events, town halls, and outreach campaigns to engage constituents

Monitoring scheduled district meetings for the Member with constituents
Maintaining a good working relationship with the Member, staff, and constituents
Accepting performance-based criticism and directions
Working well under pressure and handling stress
Working a flexible schedule including long hours, nights, and weekends
Performing other duties as assigned
requirements: Political knowledge and comfortable navigating complicated situations
Strong written, verbal, analytical, and organization skills; impeccable customer service manners; public speaking skills
Ability to multi-task, manage time effectively, and adapt to changing priorities
Ability to work a flexible schedule, including occasional nights, weekends and some holidays

office: House Committee on Education and the Workforce (Democratic Staff)
key_responsibilities: Supporting the development of legislation
Providing technical assistance to the Committee and Member offices
Researching pertinent issues
Preparing written materials and legislative analyses
Supporting the execution of committee proceedings and events related to labor law
requirements: Familiarity with the National Labor Relations Act, the Labor-Management Reporting and Disclosure Act, labor enforcement provisions in trade agreements, and employment arbitration
Knowledge of the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB), the Department of Labor’s Office of Labor-Management Standards (OLMS) and the International Labor Affairs Bureau (ILAB)
Law degree
Experience working with an organization, Congress, or government agency related to labor law
Three to five years of experience strongly preferred

Law degree
Experience working with an organization, Congress, or government agency addressing civil rights
